paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR V30M variant in the context of familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) and its implications for glaucoma patients.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Of the glaucoma eyes, ten were from FAP patients (group 1, mean age 55.4±10.0 years mean and standard deviation; five females)
Of the 21 control eyes, nine were from FAP patients with an indication for vitrectomy due to amyloid deposition (group 3, 55.9±8.5 years mean and standard deviation; four females)

functional_data.summary: The TTR V30M variant is associated with the production of amyloid fibrils leading to cellular toxicity.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR V30M variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the inability of FAP patients to increase EPO production in response to glaucoma.
key_quotes: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) is caused by the extracellular deposition of amyloid fibrils of mutant transthyretin (TTR) V30M in various tissues and organs.
FAP patients with glaucoma (group 1) and non-FAP patients with glaucoma (group 2) were comparable in terms of the IOP.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR V30M variant.
